question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
What integer $n$ satisfies $0\le n<19$ and $$-200\equiv n\pmod{19}~?$$
inference:
To find the integer $n$ that satisfies $-200 \equiv n \pmod{19}$, we first find the remainder when $-200$ is divided by $19$.
$$ -200 = -19 \times 10 + (-10) $$
Since $-10 \equiv 9 \pmod{19}$, we have
$$ -200 \equiv 9 \pmod{19} $$
So, $n = 9$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{9}$
ground_truth: Noticing that $190\equiv0\pmod{19}$ and $-200+190=-10$, we can say that  \[-200\equiv n\pmod{19}\]if and only if  \[-10\equiv n\pmod{19}.\]This is not in the range $0\leq n<19$, but adding 19 again gives \[9\equiv n\pmod{19}.\]The answer is $n=\boxed{9}$.

inference:
To find the integer $n$ that satisfies $-200 \equiv n \pmod{19}$, we first find the remainder when $-200$ is divided by $19$.
$$ -200 = -19 \times 10 + (-10) $$
Since $-10$ can be written as $19 - 10 = 9$, we have
$$ -200 = -19 \times 10 + 9 $$
$$ -200 \equiv 9 \pmod{19} $$
So, $n = 9$.

Final Answer: $\boxed{9}$
ground_truth: Noticing that $190\equiv0\pmod{19}$ and $-200+190=-10$, we can say that  \[-200\equiv n\pmod{19}\]if and only if  \[-10\equiv n\pmod{19}.\]This is not in the range $0\leq n<19$, but adding 19 again gives \[9\equiv n\pmod{19}.\]The answer is $n=\boxed{9}$.
